latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Readiness.

bill.title: Climate Change National Security Strategy Act of 2017

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Readiness.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment.
Referred to House Science, Space, and Technology
Referred to House Energy and Commerce

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committees on Armed Services, Foreign Affairs, Science, Space, and Technology, and Intelligence (Permanent Select), for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LYNCH:H.R. 2908.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18[Page H4938]

item.title: Climate Change National Security Strategy Act of 2017

To direct Federal departments and agencies to perform certain functions to ensure that climate change-related impacts are fully considered in the development of national security doctrine, policies, and plans, and for other purposes.
Climate Change National Security Strategy Act of 2017

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Climate Change National Security Strategy Act of 2017

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
